page.title: 03ORE, FAIRLIGHT, EAST SUSSEX
page.content:
This area includes some of the houses in the part of the town of Hastings, called Ore, as well as the villages of Fairlight, Guestling and Pett, East Sussex.
The housing in this part of Ore has developed between the main A.259 coastal road for through traffic from Hastings to Rye, and the minor Fairlight Road from Hastings to Fairlight village. The houses are on the south-east facing slope, rising to the viewpoint of North Seat at l75m above sea level.
The houses are 20th century buildings and are mainly owner occupied. They are mostly semi-detached family houses with two or three bedrooms. Many of the residents work in Hastings and a few work in Rye.
